name: Support Request Examples
title: Support Request Examples
body:
Overview

This article provides examples of support requests and categorizes them based on different types of issues and products. It serves as a reference guide for support teams to understand and handle various customer inquiries effectively.

Information

This guide focuses on categorizing support requests for different products and services, including EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite), Essentials, Field Support, Unipark, and other related areas. It provides examples of common issues and their corresponding ticket numbers for reference.

  • EFS Support Requests
  • Other Support Requests
  • Unipark Support
  • Academy Support

EFS Support Requests

EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite) support requests are categorized into different types based on the nature of the issue. Here's a breakdown of the common request types:

Type Description Example Tickets
How to (standard) Regular help, with the help of the manual TIVI-7392, 7393, TIVI-7289, 501, 203, 592
Accounts and rights Setup account (only shared installation and internal TIVIAN), Help with rights in EFS (team and object-rights) TIVI-7254, TIVI-7332, 154
Implementation consulting (high level) Combination of several features, within a limited scope, otherwise forwarding to PS Consultants (Jira PSIN)  
Unexpected behaviour / incorrect operation Reproduce steps, help or decide if it's a bug TIVI-7361, TIVI-7406, TIVI-7410
Expected bug Reproduce, forward to TS TIVI-123
Communication cloud move DNS changes, downtimes TIVI-401, 402, 207, 372
Communication service not available, exception reports Communication between departments and customer  
Technical requests SPF, DKIM, domains, SSL... TIVI-7111
Panel, website (module) Panelist administration, incentive management, website TIVI-7048
Request from customer for customization/ bugs in customization Forward to PS (Jira PSIN, PSBUG) TIVI-7266
Feature requests/change Request from customer Forward to PS (Jira CHRE)  

 

Other Support Requests

This section covers support requests for various other areas and products:

Type Description Example Tickets
Orders (installation, modules, addon) Orders from Sales, PS etc. (not customer directly) via https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/ collaboration between TS/SysEng TIVI-7048, 7380 (SMS Kontingent), TIVI-7407
Installation management Extend, delete organizations/installations, count CIs, accounts and panelist for invoicing Sales TIVI-20
Essentials Support expected only until 08/2022, will be taken over by Nordics. 2-3 requests per week TIVI-7317, TIVI-7213, TIVI-7423

 

Unipark Support

Unipark support includes:

  • Forum support
  • Phone support (0190)
  • Support for Olga and David (Berlin)

Example ticket: UNI-84

 

Academy Support

Academy support involves:

  • Managing registrations
  • Giving trainings
  • Setting up training materials (only standard trainings)

 

FAQ

What should I do if I receive a feature request from a customer?

If you receive a feature request or change request from a customer, forward it to PS using the Jira project CHRE.

How should I handle unexpected behavior or incorrect operation reports?

For unexpected behavior or incorrect operation reports, you should reproduce the steps, provide help, or decide if it's a bug. Refer to example tickets TIVI-7361, TIVI-7406, and TIVI-7410 for guidance.

What is the process for handling orders for installations, modules, or addons?

Orders for installations, modules, or addons should be processed through the order survey at https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/. These orders typically come from Sales or PS, not directly from customers. The process involves collaboration between TS and SysEng teams.

 

Tags: Support, EFS, Unipark, Field Support, Academy, Essentials, Customer Service, Troubleshooting
